poem:
"Unraveling Threads in the Orient's Spiral"

A Hamas chief falls,
no birdsong breaks the hush.
Terror dances 'round Iran's mourners,
The Red Sea stirs in unrest.

US jets roar above Mesopotamian soil,
each event a separate note in a piteous dirge.
Yet sewn, in the loom of turmoil,
with the threads of nameless Iranian hands.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East on the brink: inside the 12 January Guardian Weekly The assassination of a Hamas chief in Lebanon. A terror attack on mourners of an Iranian former general. Commercial shipping in the Red Sea targeted by Yemeni rebels, and a US airstrike in Iraq. All were separate events in the Middle East last week but all were linked, in one way or another, to the presence of autonomous but Iranian-backed militia forces in the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
